item.title: Caught on Camera: Tampa Police rush into burning home to save occupant
item.description: The man and officers were treated for smoke inhalation and are now OK.

item.description: Tampa Police rescue man from burning house

item.title: Expert says hurricane readiness includes financial preparedness
item.description: One analyst has some suggestions to be financially prepared for storms.

item.title: Memorial rises at the site of a deadly crash in Parrish
item.description: Two 19-year-old men were killed; two others were injured.

item.title: Flags stolen from veterans memorial in Newberry
item.description: Authorities are searching for those responsible after several flags were apparently stolen from a newly constructed veterans memorial in Newberry

item.title: Officials are investigating the cause of a Pennsylvania steel plant explosion that killed 2
item.description: Officials are working to determine the cause of an explosion that rocked a steel plant outside Pittsburgh, leaving two dead and more than 10 injured.

item.title: Trio gets felony charges for the illegal harvesting of Palmetto Berries in Charlotte County
item.description: Regulations were passed in July 2024 to protect the berry against overharvesting and poaching.

item.title: It’s down to two candidates for the next Superintendent of Manatee County Schools
item.description: It’s down to two candidates for the next Superintendent of Manatee County Schools

item.title: Erin forecast to become a major hurricane this weekend
item.description: Erin is moving quickly westward, and will continue on that trajectory for the next few days as it slowly strengthens.

item.title: Heat Builds Across Florida with Scattered Storms as we watch the tropics.
11 a.m. update: Erin to continue heading mostly west for the next day or two
item.description: Winds are estimated at around 40 mph, though that might be slightly high.
